page.title: 10Antiques in Nantwich.
page.content: The image of Nantwich as an{historic {market town}has helped to give rise to its tradition and reputation for fine art and antiques.The presence of a large number of dealers (currently 17) in a small area draws other dealers from all over Britain,Europe,and as far afield as America and Australia. The{antique shops and salerooms}are an obvious attraction for tourists However,although they like to look, tourists do not buy many antiques, which are usually bulky or fragile.In fact the main trade in antiques tends to be between dealers,and during Spring and Autumn,out of the peak tourist season.Most of the Nantwich dealers trade in general antiques, though a few specialise in furniture which is always in demand.{Stafford- {shire china}is also very popular and sold regularly at local auctions.
